issue.title: Almaif add DBDevice

milestone.description: Major version bump to 5.0 thanks to the new 'remote' driver.

issue.body: Can be used to transparently reconfigure FPGAs from different vendors using a presynthesized database of FPGA bitstreams. The database with the bitstreams is generated by github.com/cpc/AFOCL.

comment.body:
> @pjaaskel yes it is

Can we exclude / mark it XFAIL? It confuses CI users even though it passes most of the time.

comment.body:
@franz is that [heap use after free](https://github.com/pocl/pocl/actions/runs/6650533172/job/18070817720?pr=1332) with subdevices the known undeterministic problem that pops up sometimes?

@TopiLeppanen do we have a usable feature set now for the FPGA programming we could advertise with a feature page like [PoCL remote's](http://portablecl.org/remote-backend.html) (as Jan suggested)?
Best use an enum/macro to make this clearer. Magic numbers are baaad.

milestone.description: Major version bump to 5.0 thanks to the new 'remote' driver.

comment.body:
This is for commandline parameters. It just so I can rapidly switch between different AlmaIFDevice backends. I have some magic numbers for that. So it works something like this:
POCL_ALMAIF0_PARAMETERS=0xA --> XrtDevice
POCL_ALMAIF0_PARAMETERS=0xF --> DBDevice
POCL_ALMAIF0_PARAMETERS=0xE --> EmulationDevice
POCL_ALMAIF0_PARAMETERS=0xB --> TTASimDevice

commits.message:
Almaif add DBDevice

It can be used to transparently reconfigure FPGAs from different
vendors using a presynthesized database of FPGA bitstreams.
The database with the bitstreams is generated by github.com/cpc/AFOCL.

comment.body: postponing this since this will need a refactor anyway related to the DBK-work

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -249,6 +249,29 @@ Example usage of the mode can be found in examples/accel/CMakelists.txt, which
 generates standalone tests using both ttasim and RTL simulator (ghdl) to run the
 example0 kernel on various TTA configurations.
 
+
+Using bitstream database
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+You can use the AlmaIF-driver with the cross-vendor bitstream databases generated
+with the `AFOCL-project <http://github.com/cpc/AFOCL>`_.
+That project generates a directory-based database with a json-based metadata.
+The database contains the bitstreams and firmware-files necessary to implement
+the set of built-in kernels defined in the json-file.
+
+To use AFOCL-databases in PoCL, it is enough to point the Almaif-driver to the database
+with the env variable::
+
+  POCL_DEVICES=almaif POCL_ALMAIF0_PARAMETERS=0xF,<path/to/afocl-db> ./accel_example
+
+At the moment, the public AlmaIF-driver and AFOCL include support only for
+Xilinx Alveo U280 device, but adding support for other Alveo devices should be easy.
+In AFOCL publication the methodology was also demonstrated with Intel Arria 10,
+but the code for that is not yet upstreamed.
+For more information about the bitstream database,
+see our AFOCL-publication. (To be presented at NorCAS conference on 31.10.2023).
comment.body: added a citation there. Not bothering with the pre-print since the conference is coming up so soon
